content: Now charging $3/month! Pie is neat but not easy to sell and then swap stocks even as a long term strategy. Trying to sell a stock and replace it with another stock is not easily done because it thinks it's at 100% when transaction is not even done yet. One workaround to swap a stock you don't want, is to remove the stock and add ٪ to an existing stock so total equals 100%. Then exit out of "edit pie" mode then go back in and add the new stock and remove the % on the stock you added the % to.
replyContent: Hey there Bobby, we consider our trade windows a feature. If you're into long-term investing, M1 is built for investors like you. We're focused on encouraging long-term behavior. For those interested in active trading, we understand we may not be the first choice.

content: Been with M1 for a couple years and like any broker, it has pros and cons, but more pros so far for me. Major con is they do not allow automated dollar cost averaging of fixed $ amount into each holding; instead, they rebalance on the go, i.e. invest all funds into whichever "slice" lags the most behind the target allocation %. So if you want to DCA equal amounts per holding, must do it manually, which makes M1 inferior to any 401K plan. Also the Premium membership fee sucks. But the app is ok!

content: Don't trade on M1 Finance. It's pretty much a scam. They require 6 business days after a deposit to withdraw funds from your account. That's right, they'll take your money in one business day then hold your money hostage if you want to withdraw funds. And not just the deposited amount. If you have $10,000 in stocks in your account and deposit $25, the entire $10,000 and the $25 are locked into M1 for 8+ days. Also, they shut off your trading in your acct until the withdrawal completes. PURE SCAM

Hate it. Can't confirm email. All it says is that email is already confirmed, then it says in the app that I need to confirm my email. Also doesn't seem to be an option anywhere in the app to delete my account so oh well. Investing my money elsewhere.

Where do I begin? You can't sell share amounts, only dollar amounts. Why is this such a problem? Because when I tried to transfer my shares to another app, they are only able to take whole shares and the way M1 is set up you cannot sell perfectly off to a round number. Then there's the issue of taking FOREVER to take money out. I submitted a withdrawal request last Thursday and it still isn't here on the next Tuesday. Other apps are WAY faster at transfers. I have more but char limits...

I've been trying to deactivate my account. To do so, you must empty your individual accounts. I have done so, but I'm still unable to delete the "spend" account for some reason. Which results in not being to deactivate the entire M1 account. VERY ANNOYING!!!

Haven't been able to connect my bank account to start investing, so I guess I'll stick to Public. It's much easier to start investing. Edit- I was finally able to connect my bank account. Here's the thing I didn't read anywhere that if you have the free version you can only trade 1 time all day, when the market opens. This may be good for set it and forget it investors but when you start bleeding money and can't stop it...Anyway I liquidated my account & went to Public much more freedom.

Shouldn't have to send a msg to customer service just to get an, outdated, auto generated response. Started off well. Let's get back to the basics. The interface is great but the execution is lacking. A lot.

Update: Money transfer rates have been greatly enhanced, along with the apy rate hike (which came late). I'd still like a more comprehensive view/ tab of when certain actions are taken (i.e. dividend anouncements, ex dates, and pay dates) on the brokerage side, as well as showing what the current apy is for the Spend side as well as how much interest had been earned up to that point per cycle and the total amount earned. This product is finally getting better at providing info that I need.

content: Customer service is beyond terrible. My card was being declined and I called customer service and the guy tells me he can't unlock it and he's contacting the bank to resolve, and he'll get back to me later in the day. I waited and waited with no response so I emailed him back asking him if it was unlocked - he responded yes that it was. A couple of hours later I tried to use the card and of course it was declined again. I called back the next day and talked to another guy and he very slowly told me, "yeah, it looks like it's locked from fraud protection, I'll give you the number..." Apparently they don't have the ability to transfer, so I called the number he gave me, and the woman I talked to, who I could barely understand because her accent was so thick, verified the transactions and unlocked the card and I was able to use the card again. Now, three days later, I get an email from the first guy I talked to telling me that he's still working with "the bank" to rectify the situation, lol. I don't know if this guy has hacked into their system and is full of it or if they're just this bad at their jobs. Definitely not worth the $100+ annual fee to be an "M1+" member. Be very wary if you're thinking about opening an account.
replyContent: Hey there Joe, sorry about the miscommunication, it sounds frustrating to have to go through different chains of communication, but it sounds like your problem was fixed, despite the issues. Thanks for using M1.

If you are new to trading like me, make sure you do your research before you transfer Robinhood to M1. I lost about 4 stocks accounting for hundreds and hundreds of shares. They don't ask you what you want to do and RH doesn't accept incoming transfers. So you're hosed.

Update: For me, it's back to one star. Why? They're slow. Painfully slow. When you actually invest, they will wait days before your money is even counted. If you like slow and waiting (and possibly not even making it to the market) and seeing "pending" for days and days, then M1 is for you.

M1's pie investment model is amazing. I love being able to invest without having to calculate percentages and manage individual purchases. It's also interesting to try some of their "professional pies" even though I generally think a simple mix is usually best. My one peeve is the inability to link more than one deposit account per M1 account. I had to link my checking to my 'fun money' and my saving to my long term investments.

content: Nice UI and customer support (email only). Further improvements in restructuring pies will help capitalize on the apps most attractive feature, its interface. The more user-friendly m1 becomes, the more young investors will keep piling in, as seen with Robinhood. Their customer support responds same day or next business day.

STAY AWAY FROM M1. Update: it has been over 3 weeks since I asked them to transfer my account. They transferred all my positions except for one. That position is stuck with M1 and they are not answering my requests for support. There is nobody to talk to. I cannot imagine this is legal. Terrible customer service set up. Highly recommend any prudent investor to stay away from this app. If you have any issues with your account you are not likely to have them resolved easily.

replyContent: When it comes to investing, we believe in a long-term strategy that focuses on time in the market, not timing the market. We know we're not for everyone, and that's okay! We're focused on empowering long-term, self-directed investors. We welcome any additional feedback at hello@m1finance.com.

You can still navigate to the slice you want, tap buy/sell, and you may be prompted to turn off auto-invest before you can place the order. Email us if you have questions!

That's huge.
replyContent: Like Robinhood, we offer free trades and commission-free investing. However, M1 is built to be a long-term investing platform rather than an active trading platform. We limit our trading windows to keep investing commission-free while providing you with features like fractional shares and automation.

replyContent: Hey there, we're sorry to hear you've had a frustrating experience. We're unable to look into account-specific issues on this platform. If you'd like to send us additional feedback or would like help getting in touch with our support team, the best way to do that is to email us at hello@m1finance.com.

replyContent: Thanks for leaving a review. We believe that long-term investing is a sustainable way to grow your wealth, which is why we offer limited trading windows. We know that everyone has their own individual investing goals. The platform you choose is entirely up to you!

It would be an improvement if they can make reorganizing pies easier, without having to sell and then buy the same amount in the pie you want to move it to.

I like m1 finance how we get to split our shares and pay only for percentages but i would also wish that they could make their deposit more quicky. I wish i could buy and sell within the same day and not wait for a whole new day.

👍Pros: This app overall is a beginner friendly app for investing. Easy to understand and quick to get your hands on the deck. Pie chart is a great way to stay organized. This app also offers retirement account. 👎Cons: Take days for money to transfer, which for experienced investor this is a major issue. Customer service is non existent. The service response team is terrible and information change has to go through service team... Not recommend. Conclusion: I recommend Robinhood instead.

I am new to stocks and wanted to get started. I was told this app was good for that. I followed the steps to set up a portfolio, transferred money into my account and was waiting patiently for the right opportunity to buy in. To my absolute disgust I received an email saying my trade had gone through. I was bewildered and upset! The market had been high and I didn't authorize the transactions! The app is set to automatically make trades unless you specify otherwise!! I have lost $200 already!

👍 Pros: Pies are a nice touch in comparison to other apps and helps you stay organized. Fraction trading is great and affordable. The UI is pretty nice, and the setup was quick and painless. 👎 Cons: Add ability to disable a slice in a pie temporarily to avoid selling it. Add ability to move securities to other pies (reorganizing) without triggering sales. Need ability to see gains while editing a pie. 5 Day performance chart could show a date or day in the chart hover area. Can't tweak percentages for expert pies. Under research, when viewing results, there's no indicators that a stock/bond/etc. are already a part of a pie you have. The 9 A.M. trade window should be tossed out and be anytime of trade hours. Trade windows don't execute fast enough and the ability to be agile is non-existent in purchases or sales. I understand this isn't a day trade tool but the lack of flexibility in purchase options (not actual options but e.g. any time of day, limit buy, etc.) is what makes this app lose points. When viewing trade activity, you can't compare the purchase with the current cost of a specific buy/security. That is frustrating. I have to open several tabs to get a clear picture at times. The product team should really consider these points.
replyContent: Hi GM, thank you so much for sharing your feedback! We're always working on updates for the app to make it more useful for our customers, so I'm passing your feedback to our team for consideration for future updates.

This app allows you to create personalized portfolios (they call 'em pies) with no management fees or trading commissions. Pies are made up of partial shares so you can easily put a small slice in a pricey stock like Googl or BRK.A. They also offer "expert" pies, if you don't wanna eat your own cooking. Rebalancing is simple (easy as pie?). Deposits can be set to auto-invest into your pie (putting your money where your mouth is!) so you aren't stuck executing trades or having lame cash balances.

replyContent: Hi Wen, withdrawals can take 5 business days to comply with regulations set by FINRA and the SEC. M1 has to wait for funds to settle after stocks are sold (2 days) and then the funds can be disbursed to your account. From there, it can take a couple of days for your bank to receive the funds.

content: Great app

Create your own custom ETF using ETFs, CEFs, and Stocks in 1% increments. It's fun, exhilarating, and with free trades & no fees will save me money to get to my goals. Also free rebalancing, auto deposit as little as $10. No minimum balances required. Able to get into expensive stocks such as Amazon and others in fractional shares. Only downside no DRIP, but once $10 is reached in cash account it automatically invests it. Also no tax loss harvesting so best for ROTH IRAs for beginner investors
A great app for small investor to build positions overtime with fractional share

Highly recommended especially for college students!

This is NOT a trading app...its for investing. Use M1 Finance and you can buy partial shares, meaning if a stock is $50 you can buy a partial share with just $10. You would have 0.2 shares of stock. The percentage the stock goes up (or down) is the percentage your capital ($10) goes up (or down). Once you open account with $100, there is no minimum deposit amount after that. You can put in $10 a week and buy any company. And buying/selling is FREE. One of the few in the game that does this.
Easy to use investing app. Love the new update! Finally allows bi-weekly deposits to invest. Highly recommended.
Great app! Makes investing easy and the no fee structure is great.

You have a drop down window that is telling me to update however when I click that tab it goes to the sign in window but I get a warning that tells me there is an error. Please send me a phone number so I can contact you.
Great app, clean design, lots of functionality.

I'm not one to usually leave reviews for anything, but what you read about the LACK of customer service is true. Now my review is only about the opening of an account, because after a week I haven't even been able to use the system. I am not new to trading, or opening any brokerage accounts, and looking at this company I like the idea of the way they have their portfolios setup for you to personally manage. Opened an account. Then received notice they need additional verification, ID and utility bill. No problem, might have figured they need additional info since it should be a secure account, so I send it over. 3 days later receive an email that they will close my account and I can log in and reopen a new one and input the information, since the address I originally input was my mailing, and not the same as the home. Well okay, I understand the need for addresses, but why can't you just adjust the address in the system instead of closing it completely? I email back, and so far nothing 2 days later. Meantime, I tried as suggested and guess what, the new account says the same thing, they need me to send additional info same ID and utility bill for verification. Really? I just did what you said. Also with this in mind, they have the old account still there, and you wouldn't know it unless you look in the money transfer section. But of course, they are willing to connect your bank account without even a properly approved account. Wow. Something is off with this company, and if not, then they need to do some serious security work. At this point, I might as well ask the SEC if they are even a real company. And M1Finance, don't blame me for a factual review of the lack of support you offer to people who would be adding their money to your company.
replyContent: Hi Ryan, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing issues with opening your account. Please contact our support team (support@m1finance.com) and communicate this to them - they will use the documents previously provided to get you up and running.

content: I'm really happy with M1's platform. It's the perfect balance of automation and control. I can still choose exactly what I want my portfolios invested in, but the platform automates the actually buying, selling, and balancing. The app itself is high quality too, no problems there.

It's a proprietary algorithm so I can't comment on the accuracy of its buying and selling timing but it does generate a very small supplemental income of about 1% to 4% a month, but maybe it would be higher if i was better with stocks.

content: M1 Finance encourages good investment decisions. Diversification by setting a percentage of your portfolio to use for each investment, cost averaging (buy a stock frequentially to reduce buying a stock when it is more expensive than normal), fractional shares (if you have $17 dollars to invest than M1 finance sells you fractional shares with a total price of your $17. )

used to be able to queue up a trade outside of trade window (which is ambiguous for no reason) but now it will only allow you to make changes to holdings during the trade window.... used to give this app 5 stars. how can you claim to be "automatic" if you don't allow for automation of trades?
replyContent: Hi Daniel, we're sorry to hear you're experiencing problems. You should be able to queue trades outside the trading window (9am M-F so we can batch orders for frac. shares and keep the app free). If you can't do this, please contact our support team (support@m1finance.com) so they can investigate the issue and push a fix to your account.

M1 Finance gives me everything I love about robo-advisors (and more) for free. Good stuff.

There should be an option for when you decide to remove a holding from your portfolio/pie, the value is returned to you in your cash balance and not immediately reinvested into the portfolio.

I used to love this app and the self balancing features - good UI and technically helpful.  However, the customer support leaves you for wanting/expecting.  Extremely rude and not helpful at all.  I'll have to change my feedback to match my recent experience.  Consider the following exchange: Thanks Jamie, I have never been asked for a copy of my visa – on any other trading app/website. I trade on at least two other brokers and other crypto exchanges. I can just take my business elsewhere if this is a problem – and close the account. I don’t want to send out documents unnecessarily. Regards, Prashant H.   Hey Prashant,  If you do not provide us with the visa then we cannot hold your account. Please transfer it out or liquidate it.  Best regards, Jamie M1 Finance  I've had this account since August of last year - also received my tax documents this year. If this was such a big issue - why did you let me open an account in the first place?  And why did you have to wait until I emailed you asking about opening a new account for my wife to tell me this? well thanks for wasting my time!

replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having trouble organizing your portfolio! You can always create new Custom Pies with the stocks/funds you like and add them as slices in your portfolio. There's no "drag and drop" option, but you should be able to organize this way! If you have other questions, reach out to support@m1finance.com and we'll be glad to help!

replyContent: Sorry to hear you're having trouble with the UI! You can easily manage your Custom Pies in the My Pies tab (under Research). Anytime you deposit money, it will go toward your overall portfolio, so add any Pies or securities to it and you'll be able to invest in them. If you have more questions, don't hesitate to reach out to support@m1finance.com!

M1 is the simplest platform for long-term investing. I highly recommend it to those who want to set-up basic yet efficient (and free!) portfolios. Other brokerages tailor their experiences to "power users" and wannabe day-traders. Yet, empirical evidence shows that a low-maintenance approach to investing can fare as well as any over the long term. M1 embraces this by focusing on features that let you obsess less over your portfolio, like DRIP, fractional shares, and auto-rebalancing.

Not for short term trades, period. If that's what you want move on.... Now for buy and hold, long term investment, excellent app. Doesn't initiate taxable transactions (sells) without your go ahead. Rebalances by buying unless you tell it to. Make your own ETF (notionally) out of the stocks you truly believe will grow your portfolio. A great way to divy your investment by percentage, even if you can't afford a full share (aka Amazon). I feel like too many people are caught up in short term trades. I picked this app to put my money into a long term growth portfolio. I deposit weekly and ignore fluctuations in the market. If this app is the reason my portfolio crashes and burns, I will be right back here downing it.

Where else can you choose a mix of etfs and stocks, set your own distribution "pie", then have someone else conduct all those those trades and rebalances, all for no fees. Most importantly...... You invest $100 in that pie, or $100,000, fractional shares are ok! $100 barrier to entry to own so much not otherwise possible. Absolutely fantastic method to gain exposure and positions in stocks and etfs you otherwise would never be able to afford with a beginner's starting investment. Let's you learn about diversification with almost all etfs and major exchange us stocks available....and free trades essentially during the trading window each day that may involve a huge number of automatic buys and sells for rebalancing, or for closing and taking new positions. If you want to trade.... Not really the platform for you.. You don't control orders. If you want to actively manage your portfolio during downturns to hedge, or during surges to increase equity positions, it's just a matter of restructuring your pies and setting them for implementation the next trading day. Highly recommend.

Love how simple and easy to navigate it is. For me, the feeling of control 
I have with M1 is why I would pick it over Acorns or Stash. The ability to 
pick your own stocks or ETF's, while also having pre made M1 "pies" to 
choose from. Gives the experienced and new investor options to choose from. 
If your looking to actually be involved in your portfolio, pick M1. If you 
want a just set it and forget style portfolio, go with other options. 
Although you could also do this with M1. To me this would be a good app for 
people who are new investors, and would like the freedom to choose their 
own investments. Being commission free, it's a good place to start long

data to fully value a stock on this app alone. You'll need other resources

content:
To me this is the best stock/mutual fund/ETF app available. I've tried a 
lot over the last 2 years (Acorns, Betterment, Robinhood, ect.) and this is 
the best in my opinion.

This feels like a more functional and cost effective version of other 
similar apps. If you're new to investing, they have several pre-made 
portfolios that you can select from. These pre-created portfolios also 
allow you to view their back tested performance over several timeframes 
which helps in decision making. Likewise if you're an aficionado who's got 
a portfolio in mind but no bankroll, m1 finance allows you to create your 
own. The ability to periodically rebalance your holdings really makes this 
ideal. Note to those looking beyond buy-and-hold: __this app probably isn't 
for you__. If you're looking for real-time trade stuff, you'll be sorely 
disappointed as trades are only executed twice per trading day (once in 
morning near market open and once prior to close). Their service is free 
specifically bc they utilize a window-system for trade fulfillment. Again 
if you're looking to day trade, this isn't the app for you. If you're 
looking to invest over a longer period of time you'll be hard-pressed to 
find anyone who can compete with what m1 finance offers.

M1 Finance is one of those rare investing apps that does exactly what it advertises.  The features are easy to use and the app has a really clean interface.  I like how the app is free to use for the first $1,000.  This is an ingenious way for first time investors such as myself to test-drive the app.  M1 Finance allows you to search up any stock or ETF that is traded on the NYSE.  You can then add your desired stocks or ETFs to your portfolio and allocate a percentage to them.  There is absolutely no fee or commission for adding stocks or ETFs.  You can add and remove as many times as you wish and you will not pay anything for doing so.  This can save you a lot of money compared to any fund family such as Fidelity or Vanguard.  Another benefit is that the app buys fractional shares of everything so it is inexpensive to get invested into the stock market.  The fees for the app start to kick in once you surpass $1,000 in your portfolio.  The fees are very straightforward and easy to calculate.  I like how M1 Finance is honest with their fees.  They don't hide anything from you.  Overall, if you want to get into investing without forking over a lot of initial capital, I would give M1 Finance a try.  You only need $100 to start!

content: There are several reasons why I love this app.  This app is designed to satisfy the needs of beginner or seasoned investors.  Its algorithm sells when stocks are performing better than what you allocated that stock to be and redistributes the earnings from the sell to the under-performing stocks.  Essentially it buys low and sells high for you!   If you're a first time investor no problem, there are pre-made "pies" that you can start off with.  By doing so you can make a well rounded portfolio for a fraction the cost due to fractional shares.  It's low fees (first $1000 fee free), amazing algorithm, design (both app and their website), fractional shares, no commission fees make this app the best out there for long term investing.   My only wish is that they would implement some similar marketing strategies that other apps have done.  For example, perhaps a monetary incentive for recruiting additional people.  Overall great job m1finance keep it up can't wait to see this company grow as well as my investments.
Love it,  great investment tool,  simple 👍

You can completely customize your portfolio rather than being limited to a small number of preselected ETFs. I like that it has a pre built socially responsible option, as well as letting me choose individual solar, wind, and green energy stocks and ETFs. The only feature I would like to see included is the ability to trade mutual funds. I would also recommend lowering the $100 minimum initial deposit to perhaps $10 to make it more accesible for newbie and small dollar investors to get started with the platform. Otherwise a fantastic investing app.

replyContent: Tim - if you contact support@m1finance.com we can let you know why the account was rejected and what can be done to remedy the situation. Oftentimes, it's as simple as sending in a picture of a driver's license to get the account opened.

content: A FINANCIAL RIHNOSORUS
They asked me for my SSN
replyContent: We apologize for the inconvenience but we are required by law to obtain your Social Security Number and verify your identity. If you want to explore the application, you can sign into M1 via our desktop web application (m1finance.com). We are adding the ability to test drive the Android application prior to opening the account shortly.

content: I was excited at the premise, but the app has a fatal bug. It crashes on start up. It worked on download, but now won't launch at all. Non functional and has my personal and banking info!
replyContent:
Katharina,

We are sorry to hear that your recent experience with the M1 app was subpar. We have pinpointed and fixed the crash you experienced in the latest update.

We appreciate your feedback and feel free to reach out to our support if you have questions or experience further issues (via the app, website, or support@m1finance.com). Thanks!

content: As someone that has not invested in the past, this app makes it easy, I love the layout. Would recommend
As an Android Engineer I can say that this app is well made and very easy to use for any long term investing. I highly recommend this app for anyone who is new to investing as well!
Useful app for "set it and forget it" style investing. Low fees, pretty charts, and easy to add funding.
I really like that I can buy fractional shares and not have to wait until I have enough to buy whole shares. What an awesome way to manage a portfolio and make every dollar count!
Best way to manage your savings and watch them grow!
M1 is an easy to use investment platform that lets me pick my own stocks. The app has a great UI.
Similar pre-built portfolios to what I already buy individually. This is much simpler and a nice UI to boot.
